channel.title: [474]Vulcan - Bringing the past back
channel.description:
[center] [size=18pt][i][b]About us[/b][/i]:[/size] [size=12pt]Well i'm starting Vulcan 474 because I miss the old times of old RuneScape. I chose the 474 revision because on of the most popular pking item is the godsword and this is pretty much right before RuneScape went to total shit. The server will be based of rs2-474(Hyperion) by Scu11 and Vastico, the reason I have selected this source is because of the amazing combat and it has a good layout for the mini game system. I will try to emulate all old RuneScape stuff along with some custom content(mini games & bosses).[/size]
[size=18pt][b][i]Blogs/Links[/i][/b][/size] Update Blog (updated before here): http://www.tumblr.com/blog/vulcan474
[size=18pt][b]Media:[/b][/size] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/IvqyLv.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/WmsssL.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/EUSaLR.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/na3jbn.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/o5nJfH.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/CWx3EV.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/3oWHPU.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/3EwfdD.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/OgZijf.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/39P23U.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/lWER9q.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/qTtgYS.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/zEsKLy.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/el0zXp.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/FZJ2sF.png[/img]
[size=18pt][b]Developers:[/b][/size] [size=12pt]Vulcan/Kusterbeck[/size]
[size=18pt][b][i]Credits:[/i][/b][/size] [size=12pt]Graham - Hyperion Blake - Hyperion Brett - Hyperion Scu11 - Rs2-474 Vastico - Rs2-474 Scar - Rs2-474 Sir Sean [/size]
[size=18pt][b][i]If you would like to apply post here:[/i][/b][/size] http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,526294.0.html [/center]

item.title: [474]Vulcan - Bringing the past back
item.dc:creator: @Kusterbeck Kusterbeck
item.description:
@Kusterbeck wrote:

Currently working on RuneCrafting doing the essence pouches this is how i’m going to be setting up most of my skills 

package org.lucas.rs2.content.skills.runecrafting;

import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

/**
 * Handles the essence pouch data
 *  <Item Id, Amount Carried, Level required>
 * 
 * Credits <Sites>:
 *  <http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Runecrafting>
 *  <http://www.itemdb.biz/>
 * 
 * @version 1.0
 * 
 * @author Vulcan <Lucas>
 */
public enum PouchData {

    /**
     * The small pouch
     *  <Item Id, Amount Held, Level required>
     */
    SMALL_POUCH(5509, 3, 1),
    
    /**
     * The medium pouch
     */
    MEDIUM_POUCH(5510, 6, 25),
    
    /**
     * The large pouch
     */
    LARGE_POUCH(5512, 9, 50),
    
    /**
     * The giant pouch
     */
    GIANT_POUCH(5514, 12, 75);
        
    /**
     * The pouch id 
     */
    private int pouchId;
    
    /**
     * Amount that pouch can hold
     */
    private int amountHeld;
    
    /**
     * Level required for that pouch
     */
    private int levelRequired;
    
    /**
     * Maps the pouch stuff
     */
    private static Map<Integer, PouchData> pouch = new HashMap<Integer, PouchData>();

    /**
     * Represents the pouch id
     * 
     * @param pouchId
     *  The itemId
     * 
     * @param amountHeld
     *  How much the pouch can hold
     * 
     * @param levelRequired 
     *  What level do you need?
     */
    PouchData(int pouchId, int amountHeld, int levelRequired) {
        this.pouchId = pouchId;
        this.amountHeld = amountHeld;
        this.levelRequired = levelRequired;
    }
    
    /**
     * Populates the pouch map
     */
    static {
        for (final PouchData pouches : PouchData.values()) {
            pouch.put(pouches.pouchId, pouches);
	}
    }
    
    /**
     * Represents the pouches as an object Id
     * 
     * @param object
     *  Gets the object Id
     * 
     * @return 
     *  the pouch id and object
     */
    public static PouchData forId(int object) {
        return pouch.get(object);
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the pouch Id
     * 
     * @return 
     *  pouch id
     */
    public int getPouchId() {
        return pouchId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets how much the pouch can hold
     * 
     * @return 
     *  amount held
     */
    public int getAmountHeld() {
        return amountHeld;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets what level you need for the pouch
     * 
     * @return
     *  level requirement
     */
    public int getLevelRequired() {
        return levelRequired;
    }
}

Read full topic
